name: Japanese Bird's Nest Fern
climate: Prefers a warm and humid climate resembling tropical forests.
Optimal temperatures are between 70-90°F for best growth.
Does not tolerate cold climates, avoid temperatures below 50°F.
Suitable for growing indoors where a consistent climate can be maintained.
sunlight: Thrives in indirect sunlight or low light conditions indoors.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, prefer filtered light.
Placement near east or north-facing windows is ideal for growth.
Can tolerate low light levels but may grow slower as a result.
watering: Keep the soil consistently moist but avoid waterlogging.
Water the plant when the top inch feels dry to the touch.
Prefers high humidity; mist leaves regularly to maintain moisture.
Decrease watering frequency during winter as plant growth slows.
soil: Requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot and promote health.
An ideal mix is peat-based with added sand or perlite for aeration.
Avoid heavy or clay soils as they retain too much moisture.
A soil pH between 5.0 and 6.0 is preferred for optimal growth.
extra_care_tip: Regularly removing dead or yellowing leaves helps prevent disease.
Repot every couple of years to refresh soil and encourage growth.
